intro: Lipotriche scandens subsp. scandens, commonly known as the climbing bladderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Limnophytaceae. It is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic habit, often found in wetlands and shallow waters. The plant has delicate, branching stems that allow it to climb and spread across surfaces. Its flowers are tiny and inconspicuous, typically greenish or yellowish in color. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling.
